title: "The Way to Win Me Over Is" Hinge Prompt: 45 Cute & Funny Answers

steps.title: Be honest about what you’re looking for.
steps.content: Be honest about what you’re looking for. “The way to win me over” prompt is a great opportunity to let your potential matches know exactly what you’re looking for. What would win you over? Consider qualities you’re looking for in a partner so you can match with someone you’re compatible with. Here are some examples: [1] X Research source “Waking me up with kisses and coffee.” “Talking to me for hours on end about something you’re passionate about.” “Showing me off to your friends. I don’t want to hide our relationship.” “Through self-love. If you love yourself, that shows you’re capable of loving another person too.” “Remembering the little things, like my favorite color or my favorite snack.” “Apologizing when you’re wrong. Don’t worry, I will too.” “Making an effort to get along with my friends and family.” “Dates where you invite me over to try out home-cooked dinner!” “Being confident but not cocky.” “A healthy dose of PDA. I want to hold your hand in public!” “Physical affection. Expect lots of hugs, kisses, and cuddles from me!” “Not staring at your phone while we’re on a date.” “Emotional maturity. Tell me what’s bothering you.” “Consistent communication. We don’t have to talk 24/7, but let me know if you won’t be available.” “Standing up for what you believe in, but being willing to hear other people out.”

steps.title: Show off your sense of humor with your answer.
steps.content: Show off your sense of humor with your answer. Your Hinge prompts should reflect what you’re looking for in a relationship, as well as your personality. If you’ve already answered a few prompts seriously, don’t be afraid to provide a funny answer! This will let your potential matches know if you have a similar sense of humor . Here are some examples: [2] X Research source “Being (your preferred gender).” “One meme at a time.” “To take a week to text me back and when you do, it’s a dry text saying you were busy. Repeat it for maximum efficiency.” “Not to have a Hinge account to begin with. Oh, yeah. What about that paradox?” “Accepting defeat when I take the last slice of pizza.” “6 words: ‘I got you something to eat.’” “To save me from a burning building in a firefighter uniform… Or communication and honesty, or whatever.” “By proving you can keep a houseplant alive longer than I can.” “By being more excited about my dog’s birthday than mine.” “By knowing the difference between your and you’re.” “Not judging my pizza topping choices, no matter how unconventional.” “Giving me a wheel of cheese.” “Oversharing. As an oversharer myself, I appreciate hearing a lot about other people’s lives.” “Being Danny DeVito.” “Starting a fake fight about which bread type reigns supreme.”

steps.title: Base your answer on a date you’d enjoy.
steps.content: Base your answer on a date you’d enjoy. You’re ultimately using your Hinge prompts to find matches you’re compatible with, and what better way to find out than by suggesting a date? Think of something you’d like to do as a first date plan , and suggest it in your answer. Try to keep things general enough that other people would also enjoy doing them. Here are some examples: [3] X Research source “Eating more sushi than me at an all-you-can-eat sushi bar. Luckily, I know the perfect place.” “To understand all my Star Wars references. Up for a movie marathon?” “Not being embarrassed to sing Disney songs at karaoke. Let me know if you’re up for the challenge.” “Not getting bored when I spend hours in an art museum. Want to show me your favorite painting?” “To hold all my books when we go to Barnes and Noble. Don’t worry, I won’t make you carry too many on our first date.” “Hating Starbucks as passionately as I do. Show me your favorite local coffee shop?” “Being someone who loves spending all day at the cinema, watching different movies. What do you think will be the next Barbenheimer?” “Loving football as much as I do. I have an extra ticket to the next game!” “To play video games with me. Not to brag but I’m basically undefeatable. Care to prove me wrong?” “Loving rollercoasters. Wanna hit up the amusement park and see who throws up first?” “Picking out ugly outfits for each other at the thrift store and wearing them in public. Are you brave enough?” “Being artistic. Let’s take a painting or pottery class together!” “Being outdoorsy. Know any good hiking trails?” “Caring about our community! Let’s do some volunteer work together.” “By being a nerd. I’m looking for someone to go to Comic Con with!”

steps.title: Do be upfront with your intentions.
steps.content: Do be upfront with your intentions. Think about what kind of relationship you’re hoping to get out of Hinge. Are you looking for a long-term commitment or something more casual, like a hookup? Make sure your answers reflect what you’re looking for so you don’t give someone the wrong idea. [4] X Research source For example, if you want a serious relationship, answer the “way to win me over” prompt with a sincere response about qualities you seek in a partner. On the other hand, if you’re looking for a hookup, be more flirty and suggestive.

steps.title: Do focus on the positive.
steps.content: Do focus on the positive. When answering prompts about what you’re looking for, like “the way to win me over is…,” try to base your answers around what you are looking for, not what you aren’t looking for. Don’t focus on what your potential partner shouldn’t do, or what your previous partner did or didn’t do. Instead, mention positive qualities you’re looking for so your potential matches can see that you want to build a healthy relationship.

steps.title: Do make your answers conversation starters.
steps.content: Do make your answers conversation starters. Your Hinge prompts are supposed to make your potential matches want to talk to you, so make sure they have something to talk about! Avoid one-word answers or answers that make it difficult to continue a conversation. Include specific details about yourself, and consider asking a question that your matches can respond to. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Do include a mix of serious and funny answers.
steps.content: Do include a mix of serious and funny answers. While showing off your sense of humor is a great way to give your potential matches a glimpse of your personality, not every answer you provide should be funny. If you only make jokes, your matches won’t know what you’re actually looking for, and they may think you aren’t taking dating seriously. Be sure to include some sincere and honest answers so your matches get to know you. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Do be yourself.
steps.content: Do be yourself. Don’t base your Hinge prompt answers on what you think your potential matches want to hear. In order to find someone you’re truly compatible with, it’s important to be honest. Let your personality shine through, and don’t worry about impressing others. The right person will like you for who you are. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Don’t ask for too much.
steps.content: Don’t ask for too much. Be realistic about what you’re asking of your potential matches. For example, saying you want expensive gifts or dates will likely turn people away. Asking for too many things in one prompt might make you seem high maintenance or materialistic. While you shouldn’t lower your standards to get more matches, answer your prompts with the things that are actually most important to you.

steps.title: Together we could…
steps.content: Together we could… The “Together we could…” prompt is a great way to suggest date ideas to your potential matches. Answer the prompt seriously by mentioning things you actually want to do, or be a bit cheeky and opt for a humorous answer. Here are some examples: [8] X Research source “Do something casual, like get married.” “Book one-way tickets to a random destination and have the adventure of a lifetime.” “Try every taco spot in the city to definitively find the best one.”

steps.title: Dating me is like…
steps.content: Dating me is like… The “Dating me is like…” prompt is the perfect opportunity to show off your personality. While you can choose to answer this prompt seriously by letting your matches know what to expect if they date you, most people consider it a funny prompt and opt for silly answers. Here are some examples: [9] X Research source “Finding an extra chicken nugget in your McDonalds.” “Waking up and discovering you have another 3 hours of sleep before you have to get up.” “When you find out the song you’ve been skipping for the past week is actually fire.”

steps.title: I want someone who…
steps.content: I want someone who… Let your date know exactly what you’re looking for with the “I want someone who…” prompt. Think about what you’re genuinely looking for in a partner. This can be an important personality trait or some lighthearted green flags you look for. Here are some examples: [10] X Research source “Will dance with me in the living room, even if there’s no music playing.” “Looks at me the same way I look at chocolate cake.” “Doesn’t throw me through a window if I read every plaque in a museum.”

steps.title: I bet you can’t…
steps.content: I bet you can’t… If you’re looking to get a response on Hinge, the “I bet you can’t…” prompt is the perfect choice. If you say you don’t think your potential match can do something, they’ll send you a message just to prove you wrong. Just remember to keep things fun and flirty. Here are some examples: [11] X Research source “Refuse a second date with me.” “Beat me at Jenga.” “Eat more at an unlimited buffet than me.”

steps.title: The one thing I’d love to know about you is…
steps.content: The one thing I’d love to know about you is… The “one thing I’d love to know about you is…” prompt is a great conversation starter because it allows your potential matches to talk about themselves. This shows that you’re actively taking an interest in getting to know them, so it’s usually best to go for a more serious answer. Here are some examples: [12] X Research source “The title of the book that you think everyone should read.” “The 3 things that need to happen for you to have a good day.” “What you’d do if you won the lottery.”
